name: Zen Bound 2
description: Wrap your way to bliss in Zen Bound 2, the unique down-tempo indie game! This is a different gaming experience: an opportunity to slow down, zone out and focus on a task thatâ€™s challenging but not stressful, a set of gentle puzzles for the mind and fingers to solve.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP SP3 or laterProcessor: 1.6+ GHzMemory: 512 MBGraphics: OpenGL 2.0 with shader model 3 required, ATI Radeon X1300 or better, Nvidia 6000-series or betterHard Drive: 250 MB

reviews.review_text: Simplicity and Serenity are what excel in this game - great no stress time waster! Who would have thought winding a rope around a sculpture could be so addictive and challenging. Graphically very nice, music very soothing and plenty of levels to master. Going to take me a while to get 100% on all these puzzles. Check it out!    {LINK REMOVED}  If you enjoyed reading this review, please follow  True Blue Reviews  for more recommendations!

Calm and thoughtful puzzler with a nice easy learning curve. Zen Bound 2 can be relaxing or incredibly frustrating, and has something for both casual puzzle players and 100% completionists. Open level select and beautiful paint effects make it visually appealing, while gentle music adds a soothing touch.

Beautiful game.. Exellent physics and graphics. Music is so relaxing.   Get this game if you want to chill out and just play something challenging but in such a way not stressful at all.  Amazing Japanese Zen puzzles, try it out.. It's fairly cheap :) 10/10   GET IT

Finally, a puzzle game that is difficult but doesn't make me want to punch the monitor. You wrap rope around different shaped things and try to cover as much as possible, there's other mechanics added in, and it's ridiculously addictive. One problem for me though is that, for some reason, sound effects keep cutting out halfway through, but I'm sure it's either a result of my probably mediocre sound card or a bug I will get around to working out.
Really relaxing and fun. I loved the way that the game made me think and figure out the puzzles on a 3d plane, almost as if I am sitting there tieing the objects myself.
wood figurine bdsm
Relaxing. I don't like relaxing. But yea.

I guess I'm missing the 'zen' part in Zen Bound 2 over here. It isn't zen at all (if you ask me). The goal is to wrap a piece of rope around an object, trying to cover every area of this very object. But all I want to do is cover the ENTIRE area of the object (OCD anyone ?) and that's the most difficult part. Sure, you don't NEED to cover the whole area, but it's what I want to do. So no Zen moments for me. But it's enjoyable nonetheless.  [Rating: 70/100]
Pretty fun, nice and relaxing,
I have this on my iPad. For an indie title this is truly outstanding! Definately worth to buy for everyone who doesn't want a game where he can lose or die.
tie up wooden objects with rope to paint them
BDSM: The Game

*Gnome Seal of Approval* A highly original game where you have to cover different wooden objects in paint by wrapping it in colored rope. The rope is held tight while you turn the object around with your mouse.  I have not seen anything like this before and it's surprisingly challenging and entrertaining. Even frustrating at times. Some of the shapes are really tricky. Highly recommended for the casual gamer.
This is an excellent way to relax! Very nice. Excellent music.
Clever physics based puzzle game, tho it might trigger some folks' OCD. Getting the puzzles perfect seems devlishly hard. I find it relaxing.
Zen Bound is such an amazing experience. The graphics are amazing, the music is amazing, and it's presented so well. Definitely worth checking out.
A very relaxing game with a nice element of challenge.

I have barely just begun to play this game as of the time of writing and I can honestly say that this game is spectacular. It is interesting, beautiful, and overall a wonderful time. I feel so calm playing this game, like a shoe maker slowly molding his product and giving it form. Wonderful.
Played for a miniut it crashed now says i have 44 hours good job game good job IGN 10/5

This is a puzzler that is actually soothing. You may get frustrated if you're shooting for 100% completion on everything, but if you're just playing to complete the trees, you'll never get even slightly perturbed.  It's beautifully well-executed.

Do I like this game? No. Would I recommend this to someone who likes puzzle games ooooh boy yes. Basically in this game you wrap a statue up with rope to cover enough space to advance to the next puzzle.
Yeah, this game has kinda-good graphics, well simply because it's a simple game. It's innovative and I like the idea.  Ideal game for puzzle lovers.
Exceedingly boring game perhaps if you want to really indulge in your OCD you'll like it.
for all those of us who would love to get into japanese rope bondage if only we had a consenting partner.

Very unique EXTREMELY FUN AND ADDICTING point and click game! Uses neat physics and mechanics. The goal of the puzzles are to cover the whole area with paint, which is applied with rope that you tie it with, and sometimes bombs and other neat mechanics. Extremely addicting, extremely fun. Must get!
Cheaper than most fast food, and more satisfying!

I originally had this game for iOS and loved it but picked it up on a sale on computer to see it on a bigger screen. I do still prefer the controls on a touchscreen, but the graphics and the fact that you can take as long as you want to complete levels make the PC experience a pleasure as well. The only big flaw with the game is that the rope's 'stickiness' sometimes feels uneven since it will sometimes act like it's glued down and other times slip off easily. It's not a dealbreaker by far, but it does make it a bit annoying at times when close to 100% on an object.
The soundtrack is awesome. It really puts you in a zen state of mind. Play this while drinking some tea late at night or early in the morning.
It's not as relaxing as you'd think it would be.

Got it in a Humble Bundle, and decided to just give it a quick shot.  A surprisingly good meditation aid, when you're in the right mindset. Easygoing and without rush, just take time to reflect on what each sculpture is symbollically conveying and how it relates to you. It's probably impossible to rage playing this game.
This is supposed to be a relaxing game, but it just pisses me off.....>:(
